meals.name: Chole (Chickpea Curry)
instructions: Pressure cook the soaked chickpeas with some salt until soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas along with some water and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

meals.name: Paneer Tikka
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, besan, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt to make a marinade.
Add paneer cubes, capsicum, and onion cubes to the marinade and mix gently. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread marinated paneer, capsicum, and onion onto skewers.
Heat oil in a grill pan or tawa and place the skewers on it.
Cook on medium heat, turning occasionally, until paneer and vegetables are cooked and slightly charred.
Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

meals.name: Aloo Gobi (Potato and Cauliflower Curry)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets. Mix well to coat with the masala.
Cover and cook on low heat until the potatoes and cauliflower are cooked through, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

meals.name: Dal Tadka
instructions: Pressure cook the washed lentils with some salt and turmeric powder until soft and mushy.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add red chili powder and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add cooked lentils and mix well. Add water if required to adjust the consistency.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

meals.name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Fresh coriander leaves and fried onions for garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add sliced tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add sliced vegetables, yogurt, and all the spices. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Mix gently.
Add enough water to cook the rice (approximately 2 cups), cover the pan, and cook until the rice is done.
In a small bowl, soak saffron strands in warm milk and set aside.
Once the rice is cooked, drizzle the saffron-infused milk over the rice.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and fried onions. Serve hot with raita.

meals.name: Vegetable Korma
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cashew nuts, soaked in warm water for 30 minutes
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add pureed tomatoes and cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add all the spices and mix well.
Add cubed potatoes, carrots, cauliflower florets, and green peas. Mix well to coat with the masala.
Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, grind soaked cashew nuts into a smooth paste.
Once the vegetables are cooked, add cashew nut paste, yogurt, and cream. Mix well and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

meals.name: Vegetable Pakora
instructions: In a bowl, mix chickpea flour, cumin seeds, carom seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add enough water to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadhai.
Dip potato slices, onion slices, cauliflower florets, and spinach leaves into the batter and coat them evenly.
Carefully drop the coated vegetables into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crisp.
Remove from oil using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot with green chutney or tomato ketchup.

meals.name: Vegetable Pulao
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
instructions: Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add all the vegetables, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add soaked and drained rice. Mix gently to coat the rice with spices.
Add water and close the pressure cooker with its lid.
Pressure cook for 2 whistles on medium heat.
Once the pressure releases, open the lid and fluff the pulao gently with a fork.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with raita.

meals.name: Masoor Dal (Red Lentil Curry)
ingredients: 1 cup split red lentils (masoor dal), washed
instructions: Pressure cook the washed lentils with some salt and turmeric powder until soft and mushy.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add red chili powder and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add cooked lentils and mix well. Add water if required to adjust the consistency.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

meals.name: Baingan Bharta (Smoked Eggplant Curry)
instructions: Roast the eggplant directly on a gas flame or grill until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
Let the roasted eggplant cool slightly, then peel off the charred skin and mash the flesh.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add mashed eggplant and mix well. Cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

meals.name: Aloo Paratha (Stuffed Potato Flatbread)
instructions: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, salt, and enough water to make a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
In another bowl, mix mashed potatoes, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt to make the stuffing.
Divide the dough and stuffing into equal portions.
Roll out a portion of dough into a small circle. Place a portion of stuffing in the center and bring the edges of the dough together to cover the stuffing completely.
Roll out the stuffed dough into a thick circle.
Heat a tawa or griddle, place the rolled paratha on it, and cook until golden brown spots appear on both sides, flipping as needed.
Brush with oil or ghee while cooking.
Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney.

meals.name: Vegetable Upma
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, capsicum), finely chopped
instructions: Dry roast semolina in a pan until it turns golden brown and aromatic. Remove from heat and set aside.
Heat oil or ghee in the same pan, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and chana dal. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions, ginger, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Add roasted semolina, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add water (approximately double the quantity of semolina) and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook until the upma is cooked through and water is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
Fluff up the upma with a fork and serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

meals.name: Vegetable Samosa
instructions: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, salt, and oil. Add water gradually and knead into a smooth dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and coriander seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add chopped green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped carrots and green peas. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add mashed potatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Remove from heat and let the filling cool completely.
Divide the dough and filling into equal portions.
Roll out a portion of dough into a small circle. Cut it in half to form two semi-circles.
Place a portion of filling on one semi-circle, fold it over to cover the filling, and seal the edges.
Repeat with the remaining dough and filling.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadhai. Deep fry the samosas on medium heat until golden brown and crisp.
Remove from oil using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

meals.name: Vegetable Jalfrezi
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add thinly sliced capsicum, carrot, cauliflower florets, and green peas. Mix well to coat with the masala.
Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

meals.name: Vegetable Cutlet
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine boiled and mashed potatoes, carrots, green peas, sweet corn kernels, chopped onions, green chilies, grated ginger, coriander leaves, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and bread crumbs.
Mix well until everything is well combined.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape each portion into a flat round cutlet.
Heat oil in a pan for shallow frying.
Once the oil is hot, place the cutlets in the pan and fry until golden brown and crisp on both sides.
Remove from the pan and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

meals.name: Vegetable Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add cubed potatoes, sliced carrots, capsicum cubes, and green peas. Mix well to coat with the masala.
Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

meals.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped capsicum, carrots, cabbage, green beans, and green peas. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender yet crisp.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, black pepper powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add cooked rice and toss everything together until well combined.
Stir-fry for a couple of minutes until the rice is heated through.
Garnish with chopped spring onions or coriander leaves, if desired.
Serve hot as is or with any Indo-Chinese side dish.

meals.name: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Add diced carrots, potatoes, capsicum, and green peas. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes, dried thyme, dried oregano, black pepper powder, and salt. Mix well.
Pour in vegetable broth or water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 15-20 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
Serve hot with bread or crackers.

meals.name: Vegetable Uttapam
instructions: Heat a non-stick tawa or griddle over medium heat.
Pour a ladleful of dosa batter onto the center of the tawa and spread it into a thick circle.
Sprinkle chopped onions, tomatoes, capsicum, grated carrot, green chilies, and coriander leaves evenly over the batter.
Drizzle some oil or ghee around the edges and over the toppings.
Cook until the bottom side is golden brown and crisp.
Flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
Remove from the tawa and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

meals.name: Vegetable Manchurian
ingredients: 1 teaspoon corn flour dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: To make the veg balls, mix shredded cabbage, grated carrot, chopped capsicum, all-purpose flour, corn flour, ginger-garlic paste, black pepper powder, and salt in a bowl. Add a little water if needed to bind the mixture.
Shape the mixture into small balls and deep fry until golden brown and crisp. Drain excess oil on paper towels and set aside.
To make the sauce, heat oil in a pan, add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add thinly sliced onions and capsicum. Sauté until they turn slightly soft.
Add soy sauce, tomato ketchup, chili sauce, vinegar, and salt. Mix well.
Add corn flour dissolved in water and cook until the sauce thickens.
Add fried veg balls to the sauce and toss gently to coat them with the sauce.
Garnish with chopped spring onions and serve hot as an appetizer or with fried rice/noodles.
